availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Consisted of Jefferson, Shelby, Oldham, Henry counties between 1861 and 1863. Consisted of Nicholas, Bourbon, Scott, Franklin, Woodford, Fayette, Clark, Jessamine, Mercer, Boyle, Lincoln counties from 1863 to 1865. Represented by Robert Mallory from 1861 to 1865 and Brutus J. Clay from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Patrick Lewis, “Visualizing Unionism: Congressional Redistricting in 1861,”Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition blog, April 27, 2016, accessed December 26, 2019, https://civilwargovernors.org/visualizing-unionism-congressional-redistricting-in-1861/. “Congressional and Judicial District Maps, Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition, accessed December 26, 2019, http://discovery.civilwargovernors.org/congressional-and-judicial-district-maps.
